Key Match Events: Cleveland Cavaliers won 129-122 over Oklahoma City Thunder
Donovan Mitchell scored 11 points on 3-of-16 shooting
Max Strus, Dean Wade and Caris LeVert made 8 of 14 corner 3-pointers
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder's 15-game winning streak was snapped
The game was the most intense minutes of regular-season basketball seen so far this season
Others: The Thunder's defense is aggressive and aims to generate turnovers and use them to get out into the break
The Thunder allows more corner 3-point attempts per game than any other team
Cleveland's role players made their 3-pointers while Oklahoma City's role players did not
Darius Garland, Evan Mobley and Jarrett Allen had outstanding performances
Chet Holmgren's absence was noted in the game
The Thunder offense relies heavily on Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's rim gravity to suck defenses into the paint and then pass the ball out for wide-open triples
The Thunder took only 31 3-pointers in this game, down from their season average of 38.6
The Thunder should look to add a creator at the trade deadline to improve their offense
